paper_abstract: Recently, Ham and Lin introduced a notion of strong t-consistency of a (t, n) secret sharing scheme and proposed a strong (n, t, n) verifiable secret sharing (VSS). In this paper, we propose a strong (n, t, n) VSS which is more efficient than Ham n and Lin's VSS. Using the same approach, we propose a (n, t, n) multi-secret sharing scheme (MSS) to allow shareholders to share n - t + 1 secrets. Also, the proposed (n, t, n) MSS can be modified to include the verifiable feature. All proposed schemes are unconditionally secure and are based on Shamir's (t, n) secret sharing scheme. paper_title: Efficient (n, t, n) secret sharing schemes
